nodes.text: Bane back spiders were large non-sentient arachnids native to various regions of Dathomir. They were able to project their poisonous saliva to ward off threats.

As they were arachnids, bane back spiders possessed eight legs and an armored exoskeleton. Their exoskeleton was dark and the spiders had four black eyes. In attack, the spiders were capable of projecting their poisonous saliva at enemies. In addition, the spiders  would emit a toxic acid upon dying. They were known to skitter and climb with agility.

Bane back spiders primarily lived in holes in the floors of Dathomir. The spiders were hostile to most sentient lifeforms. When threatened, they were capable of quick, swift attacks and took control of their agility, jumping back short distances.

By 14 BBY, the Nightbrothers had only recently begun efforts to domesticate the bane back spider. Without the Nightsisters' magickal antivenoms, the task had occasionally proved deadly. However, if a spider was captured young and raised alongside a Nightbrother, it would bond with him and become a lasting companion. Domesticated spiders would live with their Nightbrother owners in their village.
In 14 BBY, during Cal Kestis' mission to Dathomir, he encountered many bane back spiders that proved to be a nuisance to him.

Bane back spiders appeared in the current Star Wars canon in the 2019 video game Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order. The species originated in the Star Wars Legends continuity, where they were created for the 2003 MMORPG Star Wars Galaxies.
